treaties.significance: Foundation of modern international human rights system
First universal articulation of human rights. Adopted by UN General Assembly Resolution 217 A (III). December 10 is celebrated as Human Rights Day.

keyArticles.title: Born free and equal
keyArticles.text: All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights.

keyArticles.title: Non-discrimination
keyArticles.text: Everyone is entitled to all the rights and freedoms set forth in this Declaration, without distinction of any kind.

keyArticles.title: Right to life
keyArticles.text: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and security of person.

treaties.fullName: International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

keyArticles.title: Freedom of thought, conscience and religion

treaties.significance: Together with ICESCR, transforms UDHR into binding treaty law. Part of the International Bill of Human Rights.

treaties.fullName: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights
treaties.significance: Codifies economic, social and cultural rights. Subject to progressive realization based on available resources.

treaties.fullName: International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination
treaties.significance: First UN human rights treaty. Defines racial discrimination and requires states to eliminate it in all forms.

treaties.fullName: Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women
treaties.significance: Often described as international bill of rights for women. Addresses discrimination in political, economic, social, cultural and civil spheres.

treaties.fullName: Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment
treaties.significance: Establishes absolute prohibition of torture. Creates obligation of non-refoulement.

treaties.fullName: Convention on the Rights of the Child
treaties.significance: Most widely ratified human rights treaty (only US not party). Introduces 'best interests of the child' principle.

treaties.fullName: International Convention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families
treaties.significance: Comprehensive treaty on migrant workers' rights. Low ratification, especially among destination countries.

treaties.fullName: Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities
treaties.significance: Paradigm shift from medical to social model of disability. First treaty negotiated with significant civil society participation.

treaties.fullName: International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance
treaties.significance: Addresses enforced disappearance as crime against humanity. Creates urgent action procedure.

keyArticles.title: Right to respect for private and family life

treaties.significance: First regional human rights treaty. Most developed enforcement mechanism with individual access to court.

treaties.fullName: Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
treaties.significance: Became legally binding with Lisbon Treaty. Applies to EU institutions and member states when implementing EU law.
Core instrument of Inter-American human rights system. US has not ratified.

treaties.fullName: African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights
treaties.significance: Unique in including peoples' rights and individual duties. Reflects African communitarian values.
